Epigraph: "I know my love by his way of walking and I Know my love by his way of talking"
"I never will marry, I'll be no man's wife. I intend to stay single for the rest of my life."
"I've been a wild rover for many the year"
"Her eyes they shone like diamonds, you'd think she was queen of the land."
"Ah, kiss me, love, and miss me, love, and dry your bitter tears."
"Come away! O, human child! To the woods and waters wild, Witih a fairy hand in hand, For the world's more full of weeping than you can understand."
"Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous, but who is able to stand before envy?"
"Give sorrow words: the grief that does not speak Whispers the o'er-fraught heart and bids it break."
"Live all you can, it's a mistake not to."
"Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there, wondering, fearing, Doubting, dreaming dreams no mortal ever dared to dream before."
"To believe only possibilities is not faith, but mere philosophy."
"He either fears his fate too much, Or his desets are small, That puts it not unto the touch, To win or lose it all."
"Men would be angels, angels would be gods."
"What's past is prologue"
"And the Lord said to Satan, 'Whence do you come?' Then Satan answered the Lord and said, 'From roaming the earth and patrolling it.'"
"He who has understanding, let him calculate the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man."
"Women are your fields. Go, then, into your fields as you please."
"He was her man, but he done her wrong."
"Himself a shadow, hunting shadows."
"Always set a thief to catch a thief."
"Soon or late love is his own avenger."
"The bitter past, more welcome is the sweet."
“What's past is prologue.”
“Violence is as American as cherry pie.”
“There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio, Than are dreamt of in your philosophy.”
“We may not pay Satan reverence, for that would be indiscreet, but we can at least respect his talents.”
“And what rough beast, its hour come round at last, Slouches toward Bethlehem to be born?”
“Nobody shoots at Santa Claus.”
“All men think all men mortal but themselves.”
“Let us hob-and-nob with Death.”
“The vices of authority are chiefly four: delays, corruption, roughness and facility.”
“More things belong to marriage than four bare legs in a bed.”
“It is sweet to dance to violins When Love and Life are Fair: To dance to flutes, to dance to lutes Is delicate and rare: But it is not sweet with nimble feet To dance upon the air!"
"'Behold!'  The jaws of darkness do devour it up: So quick bright things come to confusion.”

“O love! O fire! once he drew
 With one long kiss my whole soul through
 My lips; as sunlight drinketh dew. ”
“We bow our heads before Thee, and we laud And magnify thy name Almighty God! But man is thy most awful instrumentIn working out a pure intent.”
“In friendship false, implacable in hate, Resolv'd to ruin or to rule the state.”
"The light of the body is in the eye"

"A mother is a mother still,
The holiest thing alive."
“It takes two to speak the truth- one to speak, and another to hear.”

Epigraph Author: “From the Treasury of Gardening, on transplanting potted plants”
Epigraph: “If the plant root ball is tightly packed with roots, these should be gently loosened. They need to spread out after planting,rather than continue to grow in a tight mass.”
“And 'tis my faith that every flower Enjoys the air it breathes.”

"Grafting and budding involve joining two separate plants so that they function as one, creating a strong, healthy plant that has only the
best characteristics as its two parents."
"Youth fades; love droops, the leaves of friendship fall; a mother’s secret hope outlives them all."
"None but the brave deserves the fair"

"Finish, good lady; the bright day is done, And
we are for the dark."

Extra Notes: 2 part epigraph, special font, uppercase author
Epigraph: "What we learn to do, we learn by doing."

Extra Notes: 2 part epigraph, special font, uppercase author
Epigraph: "We few, we happy few, we band of brothers."
“Good and evil, we know, in the field of this world grow up together almost inseparably."
"Presume not that I am the thing I was."
“The Sun’s rim dips; the stars rush out, At one stride comes the dark."
"Whence and what art thou, execrable shape?"
“Where God hath a temple, the Devil will have a chapel."
"The childhood shows the man As morning shows the day."
“Keep the home fires burning."
"The natural flights of the human mind are not from pleasure to pleasure, but from hope to hope."
"Where there is no vision, the people perish."
"I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears, and sweat."
“Love is strong as death."
"Whence and what art thou, execrable shape?"
“Who knows what evil lurks in the hearts of men?"
"Good and evil we know in the field of this world grow up together almost inseparably."
